data.prayer: Lord, please give apostles to expand the church into every neighborhood of Saga, Japan.
data.verse: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Saga, Japan
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Jesus, help the church in the state of Saga to not rely on buildings or programs, but on your Spirit and the simple faithfulness of every believer.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 176 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, answer the requests of your people in the state of Saga.
data.verse: This is the boldness which we have toward him, that, if we ask anything according to his will, he listens to us.

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 4,753 believers in the state of Saga with tears, because God is not obeyed by those around them.
data.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

data.prayer: Father, I pray against the principalities, against the powers, against the world’s rulers of darkness of this age, and against the spiritual forces of the wickedness in the heavenly places that are warring against the Japanese people.
Father, grace the churches in Saga, Japan with faithful local leaders.
data.verse: Where there is no guidance, a people falls, but in an abundance of counselors there is safety.

data.prayer: Spirit, help the 4,753 believers in Saga to start simple multiplying churches in their homes.
Lord, like in the church of Antioch, where you gathered many prophets and teachers, please gather many prophets and teachers in the state of Saga, Japan.
data.verse: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.

location.name: Saga
location.people_groups_list: Burakumin, Persian, Deaf, Mongol, Khalka, Judeo-Japanese
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Burakumin (887,000), Persian (50,000), Deaf (253,000), Mongol, Khalka (4,500), Judeo-Japanese (50,000)
